meanings.definition: Beyond reality; more real than reality itself.
meanings.sent1: The movie's special effects created a hyperreal experience for the audience.
meanings.sent2: The hyperreal painting looked almost lifelike.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealistic cake was so detailed that it fooled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperreal dreams felt more vivid than her waking moments.
meanings.sent5: The hyperreal colors of the sunset painted the sky in a mesmerizing way.

meanings.definition: A style of art that aims to depict reality in an exaggerated or heightened way.
meanings.sent1: The hyperreal in the museum caught the attention of many visitors.
meanings.sent2: The artist's hyperreal technique made the still life look almost three-dimensional.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealism of the sculpture made it seem like it could come to life at any moment.
meanings.sent4: The hyperreal portrayal of nature in the painting was both captivating and surreal.
meanings.sent5: The hyperreal details in the artwork revealed the artist's meticulous attention to realism.
